questions.question: This field involves the recovery and investigation of material found in digital devices, often in relation to computer crime.
This type of analysis involves examining digital evidence to reconstruct events and actions taken on a device.
This term refers to the process of creating an exact copy of digital data for analysis without altering the original data.
This tool is commonly used in digital forensics to analyze and recover data from hard drives.
This term refers to the practice of documenting the handling and analysis of digital evidence to ensure its integrity.
